channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Harris primed for first campaign interview as critics rail against alleged lack of substance, sit-downs
item.description: Vice President Harris and her running mate, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, are expected to sit down for interview with CNN on Thursday night.

item.title: Trump reposts sexual innuendo about Harris on Truth Social
item.description: Former President Donald Trump reposted a crude sexual insult about his Democratic rival Wednesday, implying that her political career began in the bedroom.

item.title: Harris and Walz Don’t Believe in ‘Freedom.’ They Just Believe in Environmentalism
item.description: The Democratic ticket is trying to dress up its top-down and ineffective environmental policies in a pro-liberty guise. Don’t buy it.

item.title: First Amendment Group Says It Plans To Support Arizona Resident Arrested For Speaking At City Meeting
item.description: A First Amendment group indicated plans to sue Surprise, Arizona, after its mayor had a resident arrested for speaking at a public meeting.

item.title: NJ residents hit with doubled bills as lawmakers fume at Murphy's ‘energy disaster plan,' demand hearings
item.description: New Jersey residents felt sticker shock from their latest energy bills; several state and at least one federal lawmaker are calling for commonsense policy change and investigations.

item.title: Utah governor takes heat over Arlington National Cemetery photo with Trump in campaign email
item.description: Utah Republican Gov. Spencer Cox came under criticism Wednesday for sending a campaign email that included a photo of him and Donald Trump at Arlington National Cemetery during a wreath-laying ceremony.

item.title: Democrats Cover Up the Costly Failures of the Inflation Reduction Act
item.description: Biden and Harris hope that policy trickery can delay the massive Medicare Part D premium hikes their policies will cause until after the November election.

item.title: Mayo, Cleveland Clinic, And Other Major Hospital Systems Put White People At Back Of Treatment Lines
item.description: Patients and their families should reject programs that undermine individualized medicine in favor of racially balanced outcomes.

item.title: Report: USAID staff warned Gaza pier could sap Israel's willingness to open 'more efficient' aid corridors
item.description: USAID Office of the Inspector General report indicates "multiple" agency officials disagreed with the Biden administration's decision to build a humanitarian aid pier off Gaza.

item.title: FBI releases new information on Trump assassination investigation, contradicting lawmaker reports
item.description: The FBI released new information Wednesday on its investigation into the attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump, defending its handling of the crime scene and contradicting some information lawmakers have reported in recent weeks.

item.title: A Visit to the Mount, Edith Wharton’s Berkshires Estate
item.description: The great writer was also a great designer and decorator of houses, and her beloved ‘cottage’ is a work of art.

item.title: ‘Joy’ Rhetoric Is An Orwellian Attempt To Hide Democrats’ Hatred
item.description: The Democrat machine has not yet come out openly to declare that ‘hate is love,’ but they might as well. Because getting people to hate one another is their goal.

item.title: This state may decide whether Harris or Trump wins the 2024 presidential election
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris is making a statement that Georgia is in play against Donald Trump as she makes it her first stop after last week's Democratic convention

item.title: Media anticipates Harris-Walz interview
item.description: The prospect of a debut interview with Democratic presidential nominee Kamala Harris and running mate Tim Walz on Thursday on CNN has sparked considerable interest from other news organizations. Here are a few examples of that coverage from the last 24 hours.

item.title: Questions for Kamala
item.description: Harris will be giving her first interview as a presidential candidate on Thursday night. Here are some ideas about what she should be asked.

item.title: ‘This Is Fraud’: Ohio Investigators Looking Into Suspect Voter Registrations Tied To Left-Wing Firm
item.description: Allegations of fraud have been tied to Black Fork Strategies, a left-wing Ohio firm committed to 'building long-term progressive power.'

item.title: Washington state's homeownership program offers loans based solely on race
item.description: A new program in Washington state called the Covenant Homeownership Program offers loans to people solely based on their race and having a family member who was alive before 1968.

item.title: Polaris Dawn civilian spacewalk mission delayed after FAA demands probe into Falcon 9 booster rocket
item.description: The Polaris Dawn mission aiming for the first commercial spacewalk is now delayed indefinitely after the Federal Aviation Administration grounded the entire SpaceX fleet of Falcon 9 rockets.

item.title: The Adept Mr. Vance
item.description: He hasn’t made a misstep.

item.title: J.D. Vance’s D.C. Suburb Is Only ‘Hate-Free’ If You Agree With Democrat Authoritarians
item.description: Del Ray leftists aren't alone in their authoritarian tactics — or in their inability to recognize their authoritarianism.
